title: mk jogo is bannable?
body:
i want to play with skins.
i found a program called mk jogo
if i use it will i get ban?
i dont want to take the risk.
i will use it only if the program is 100% sure unbannble
thx

replies.body:
Targons Blade has outlined how to judge for yourself.

I can elaborate on this exact case, MKjogo is in fact banable right now, there was a general list made by a Riot employee on a post that you may have to seek out for exact information.

If you're looking for skin changing things, there are a few allowed that you can overview on that post if you're able to find it.


_**Please keep in mind that the allowed programs are subject to change at any given time, please use your best judgement as losing your account for a 3rd party program hurts, I know this from my own stupid experience.**_

We cannot 100% confirm whether an application that modifies League files is bannable or not. Because these applications are made by third-party developers who can slip features in without you noticing a change, you can end up with something that offers you a competitive advantage without knowing it's there. 

When in doubt, avoid using the application altogether. Always ask yourself *"is this application worth potentially losing my account over?"*

Let me know if you have any questions.

You guys could always make it a little easier on the modding community. The way your game is built, it is VERY HARD to mod. I mean fuck, even the fucking SOUND FILES are packaged into some obscure format that requires really expensive sound software to modify.

And even if you know how to modify the sound or the skins... If you don't do it properly your game client will "repair" the mod and get rid of it.

If it was easier, people wouldn't need to rely on 3rd party tools. JUST SAYING.
